job.description:
{"@context": "http://schema.org", "@type": "JobPosting", "datePosted": "2021-07-22T01:12:08.000Z", "description": "

If you are a Colorado resident and this role is a field-based or remote role, you may be eligible to receive additional information about the compensation and benefits for this role, which we will provide upon request.\u00a0 You may contact 888-367-7223, option 5, for assistance.

Your Challenge

The Software Development Engineer 3 position provides the successful candidate with an immediate opportunity to be involved with the manufacture of technology that is helping to save lives, improve patient outcomes and reduce the cost of medicine across the globe. The technology is a cornerstone in the Philips Healthtech portfolio and has proven to be elusive to our competitors. As an international organization, Philips is well placed to offer a broad range of technical and leadership opportunities in various organizations throughout the world.

Your Team

This role will be a part of the Ultrasound Software Development team in Cambridge, MA.

Our Offer

At Philips, we are driven by our mission to improve the lives of 2.5 billion people by 2030, and every day we move closer to achieving our goal by creating cutting-edge solutions that lead to confident diagnosis, improved care, and increased quality of life for patients. Thanks to our employees who share our passion for improving lives, we are at the forefront of the Healthcare industry leading in image guided interventions, ultrasound, patient monitoring, cardiology informatics, sleep therapy and respiratory care. We enable our employees to create a legacy in life through their work and support their development through people-centric learning, total rewards and personalized development planning programs.

We are Looking For:

  • BS or MS in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, Electrical Engineering, or equivalent

  • At least four years experience in software development/engineering including requirements analysis, software development, installation, integration, evaluation, enhancement, maintenance, testing, and problem diagnosis/resolution. The individual must be able to communicate directions and provide guidance to junior engineers, as required

  • Familiarity with embedded system development a plus

  • Extensive Experience with object-oriented programming languages (e.g. C++), design and coding

  • Signal image processing experience preferred, but not required

  • Ability to analyze and solve complex problems. Strong desire to learn and adapt to new technologies and challenges

  • Knowledge of software development lifecycle

  • Strong interpersonal and communication skills with the ability to interface in a cross-disciplinary manner, including engineers, product managers, and clinical specialists

  • Self-motivated individual with good organizational and time management skills

  • Familiarity with medical devices and/or working in a regulated environment a plus

Why should you join Philips?\u00a0

Working at\u00a0Philips\u00a0is more than a job. It\u2019s a calling to create a healthier society through meaningful work, focused on improving\u00a03 billion\u00a0lives\u00a0a year by\u00a0delivering\u00a0innovative\u00a0solutions across the\u00a0health continuum.\u00a0Our people experience a variety of unexpected moments when their lives and careers come together in meaningful ways. Learn more by\u00a0watching this video.\u00a0\u00a0

To find out more about what it\u2019s like\u00a0working for Philips at a personal level,\u00a0visit the\u00a0Working at Philips page\u00a0on our career website, where you can read stories from\u00a0our\u00a0employee blog.\u00a0Once there,\u00a0you can also learn about\u00a0our\u00a0recruitment process,\u00a0or\u00a0find answers to some of the\u00a0frequently asked questions.\u00a0

It is the policy of Philips to provide equal employment and advancement opportunities to all colleagues and applicants for employment without regard to race, color, ethnicity, religion, gender, pregnancy/childbirth, age, national origin, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, disability or perceived disability, genetic information, citizenship, veteran or military status or a person\u2019s relationship or association with a protected veteran, including spouses and other family members, marital or domestic partner status, or any other category protected by federal, state and/or local laws.\u00a0

As an equal opportunity employer, Philips is committed to a diverse workforce. In order to ensure reasonable accommodation for individuals protected by Section 503 of the Rehabilitation Act of 1973, the Vietnam Veterans' Readjustment Act of 1974, and Title I of the Americans with Disabilities Act of 1990, applicants that require accommodation in the job application process may contact 888-367-7223, option 5, for assistance.\u00a0

Equal Employment and Opportunity Employer/Disabled/Veteran\u00a0
